item.title: HTML Basics: 2
item.description: This page is a continuation of the previous post about me learning HTML and CSS. CSS Stands for Cascading Style Sheets, a way to define how HTML pages look. CSS can control how multiple pages look at once. Can be done inline, like with the previously mentioned style options. <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <body> <h1 style="color:red"> Example Header </h1> </body> </html> Can also be done internally, within the style HTML tags within the head to set style for all the same elements in the HTML document.

item.title: Creating This Website
item.description: This simple personal website was made following this book: blogdown: Creating Websites with R Markdown I am using it as a simple, easily managed portfolio and personal website, documenting personal projects and other content. Technologies Used: Markdown (Using Typora) R (Using R Studio) Github Netlify All posts are written in Typora, my preferred Markdown editor. Markdown is a simple markup language, that I think makes exceptionally clean and modern websites.
